file_content.text: Grov put up a fight, but he didn't live up to his namesake. His ultimate fate is yours to decide.
You've found Grov the Destroyer?
This one won't trouble you or your boss anymore--unless you initiate the thawing sequence.
You must be Lo'tar. Let's talk.
I take it this is proof enough?
Your "Destroyer" has been destroyed.
What? Oh. This is about the contract. Of course. That's why I'm here. Not because I'm hiding out or anything....
There's this Evocii gangster. Calls himself "Grov the Destroyer"--which is appropriate, because he's destroying my boss's business. Challenging the Hutts--what's he thinking, right?
If I don't stop Grov's operations, my boss will throw me to the chemilizards. And if he doesn't, Grov's hired thugs will.
You've made a wise choice. Grov's gang doesn't stand a chance.
No need to worry.
When this is over, it's Grov's people who will be lizard food.
Not if they're dead.
Why won't you say who you work for?
Who's your boss?
I'm in enough trouble already without word getting around I took on outside help.
Good luck with the hunt. I'll be right here--with a stiff drink.
Now there's a plan I can get behind.
That's a real load off. You have no idea.
Fat chance. I swear, that wasn't a Hutt pun.
Who's lizard food? Not me--and that's what really matters.
For a job well done.
Yeah. Once his gangster herd got thinned out, Grov had to pick up the slack, get more personally committed.
Now that he's stuck his head out, I'm hoping he'll lose it. Then I can keep my job--and, you know, my life.
Oh, thank you. Thank you. I can't tell you how much this means.
I'll worry about that later. What matters is the Destroyer's done. Finished.
What am I saying? Of course I can. I have credits.
Better get back to work. I told the boss I was going to the 'fresher. Hope he doesn't notice I've been gone so long.
And what matters more--I'm not going to be anybody's lizard food. Best credits I ever spent.
